Questions.Question: Which of the following would be the result of a spinal lesion at the level of C7?
Questions.Option3: loss of sensation over the lateral aspect of the arm

Questions.Question: Which of the following regarding the anatomy of the heart is true?
Questions.Option2: The ascending aorta is entirely outside the pericardial sac.
Questions.Option3: The pulmonary trunk lies anterior to the ascending aorta.
Questions.Option4: The right atrium is posterior to the left atrium.

Questions.Question: Which ONE of the following would be expected in a third nerve palsy?
Which of the following anatomical considerations is correct:
Questions.Option1: central scotoma occurs early in papilloedema
Questions.Option2: in cortical blindness pupillary reactions are abnormal
Questions.Option3: opticokinetic nystagmus is found with bilateral infarction
Questions.Option4: optic chiasm lesions characteristically produce a bitemporal hemianopia
Questions.Correct: optic chiasm lesions characteristically produce a bitemporal hemianopia
